title: The Mysterious Planet
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor reassures Peri: 'Planets come and go, stars perish, matter disperses, coalesces, forms into other patterns, other worlds. Nothing can be eternal.'
dialogue_disasters: The Valeyard: 'I intend to adumbrate two typical instances from separate epistopic interfaces of the spectrum.'

continuity_notes.name: Cloister Bell
continuity_notes.description: A warning device in the TARDIS that rings when extreme danger is near.
continuity_notes.current_status: Rings as the TARDIS is drawn to the space station

continuity_notes.name: Time Lord Space Station
continuity_notes.description: A space station used by Time Lords, possibly above Gallifrey or a TARDIS in flight.

continuity_notes.name: The Matrix
continuity_notes.description: Repository of all Time Lord knowledge, capable of accessing experiences from all Time Lords.
continuity_notes.current_status: Used to present evidence in the trial

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord on trial, formerly President of Gallifrey
continuity_notes.current_status: Charged with conduct unbecoming a Time Lord and transgressing the First Law of Time

technobabble: Black light explosion could affect the whole universe
The aerial converts ultra-violet into black light
roots: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
links: The Doctor mentions Sarah Jane while semi-conscious

locations.name: Ravolox
locations.description: Actually Earth, moved and devastated by a fireball
locations.current_status: Post-apocalyptic world, two million years after the 20th century

locations.name: London
locations.description: Former Earth city, now part of Ravolox
locations.current_status: Near Marble Arch tube station, inhabited by the Tribe of the Free

future_history: Earth and its solar system moved 'a couple of light years' at least two million years after the 20th century. Ravolox/Earth was 'destroyed' by a solar fireball 500 years before this story.
untold_adventures: The Doctor's previous enquiries and tribunals
qv: The Location of Gallifrey, 'Terror of the Autons'
additional_notes: The story features several unique elements such as the Sleepers from Andromeda, the underground dwellers calling their world UK Habitat, and Glitz's background from Salostophus in the Andromeda galaxy.
bottom_line: A good, traditional story, with great design and direction. At this stage the trial scenes aren't intrusive, and it really feels like Doctor Who, on the way to an epic.
